    • Method Detail

      • parsePost

        protected boolean parsePost(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> errors,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params,
                            boolean skip_null)
        parse a map containing the POST parameters for this Form. Fill in the Per field errors and return parse status. Parse post may be called in a Servlet to interpret a POST or by a form when displaying errors. Even though we have been passed the missing fields and the error map on an error display we re-parse the params to initialise the state of the correct fields.
        Parameters:
        errors -
        params - These may be Strings from POST parameters or objects from default values
        skip_null - skip null inputs if true.
        Returns:
        boolean true if all OK
        Throws:
        FieldException

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> missing_fields,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> errors)
        Validate the form storing error information. Any field that already has an error recorded is assumed to have failed the parse stage and is skipped
        Parameters:
        missing_fields -
        errors -
        Returns:
        boolean true if no errors

      • getShortcutAction

        public FormAction getShortcutAction(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
                             throws FieldException,
                                    ActionException
        return the FormAction for non validating actions. These ignore the form state as this is intended for cancel/retire actions though we still may want the action to request confirmation.
        Parameters:
        params -
        Returns:
        FormAction or null
        Throws:
        FieldException
        ActionException

      • addStringMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> addStringMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        return a map of values. This is used in tests to extract the default values from a form.
        Returns:
        Map
